modules.description: Converts process status values to human-readable strings and formats error results from process executions. Works with process identifiers and result records containing exit codes and error messages. Used to generate log entries and user-facing error messages when shell commands fail.

Provides functions to execute system commands and run shell processes, handling input, output, and exit codes. Works with strings for command lines and process results, and with file descriptors for I/O redirection. Used to automate system tasks, integrate with shell scripts, and capture command output for processing.

Provides utilities for interpreting and formatting process execution results, including converting exit codes to readable status messages and handling error outputs. Main data types include process identifiers, result records, and error messages, with operations for logging and user feedback. It enables generating detailed logs and actionable error messages from failed shell commands. For example, it can transform an exit code of 127 into "Command not found" or format a command's stderr output for display.
